extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
AT.Outcomes: response rate, progression-free survival, diarrhoea, dilation, nausea, transaminase increase, creatinine increase, QTc time prolongation

DE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
DE.Outcomes: overall survival, response rates, progression-free survival, adverse events, Karnofsky performance status, ECOG performance status

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
DK.Outcomes: objective response rate, progression-free survival, diarrhoea, alanine aminotransferase increase, aspartate aminotransferase increase, neutropenia, fatigue, febrile neutropenia

EN.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
EN.Outcomes: overall survival, progression-free survival, health-related quality of life, objective response rate (RECIST 1.1), adverse events, EORTC QLQ-C30, EORTC QLQ-LC13, EQ-5D-5L

EU.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

FR.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
FR.Outcomes: serious side effects on the skin

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
NL.Outcomes: progression free survival, quality of life, overall survival, objective response rate, adverse events

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
SE.Outcomes: symptom control, preservation of quality of life, prolonged survival
